article_title: Voter Guide: Boulder and Broomfield counties 2013
article_text:
POLLING CENTERS

Boulder County

Four voter service and polling centers will be available in Boulder County. Visit a voter service and polling center to: drop off your ballot, cast a ballot in person, request a replacement ballot, register to vote or update your registration information, or vote using equipment and facilities for persons with disabilities.

Boulder clerk's office, 1750 33rd St., 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 15-25, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 28-Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5.

Longmont clerk's office, 529 Coffman St., 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 21-Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Lafayette clerks' office, 1376 Miners Drive, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 28-Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

University Club, University of Colorado, 972 Broadway, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 28-Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Broomfield

One voter service and polling center will be available in Broomfield. Visit a voter service and polling center to: drop off your ballot, cast a ballot in person, request a replacement ballot, register to vote or update your registration information, or vote using equipment and facilities for persons with disabilities.

George DiCiero City and County Building, 1 DesCombes Drive, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 15-Nov. 1, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 2; 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

BALLOT DROP-OFF



Boulder County

Boulder clerk's office, 1750 33rd St., 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Boulder County Courthouse, Treasurer's Office (walk-in ballot drop-off only), 1325 Pearl St., 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 15-Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Longmont Drive-up Ballot Collection, 534 Terry St., 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Louisville Steinbaugh Pavilion, 824 Front St., 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Lafayette Public Library, 775 W. Baseline Road, 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Lyons Town Hall, 432 Fifth Ave., 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Nederland Community Center, 750 North Highway 72, 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4; 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Broomfield

George DiCiero City and County Building, 1 DesCombes Drive, Utility Payment Box (in front of Motor Vehicle Office), 24 hours/day, 7 days/week; closed at 7 p.m. Nov. 5

King Soopers, 1150 U.S. Highway 287, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

North Metro Fire Station 64, 13515 Lowell Blvd., 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

Risen Savior Lutheran Church, 3031 W 144th Ave., 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 1, Nov. 2 and Nov. 4, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 5

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Camera staff

twitter.description: All eligible voters who have requested mail-in ballots should begin receiving them later this week. Ballots cannot be forwarded, so the county clerk's office needs your current information. It's too late to register to vote in time for the election, but voters can verify online that they're properly registered and request mail-in ballots:
twitter.title: Voter Guide: Boulder and Broomfield counties 2013
